title: Police identify 3-year-old fatally shot by child playing with gun
content:
YPSILANTI TOWNSHIP, MI - Police have identified a 3-year-old boy shot and killed in what they believe was an accidental shooting.
Jamari Lamar Moore died Sunday, Nov. 13 after being shot in the neck in the Country Meadows Apartment complex, 212 Stevens Drive in Ypsilanti Township.
Police, who were called to the scene about 1:25 p.m., have said they believe the toddler was shot accidentally while another child was playing with a gun in the home.
Loved ones huddled together as a woman cried out at the scene of the shooting death of a 3-year-old boy on Sunday, Nov. 13.
Several children and Moore's mother were in the home at the time of the incident, Washtenaw County Sheriff's Office Detective Lt. Jim Anuszkiewicz said at the scene Sunday night. However, detectives were still investigating who owned the gun and the circumstances of the incident.
An autopsy was underway Monday morning, Anuszkiewicz said.
